pychell API reference¶

pychell makes use of specific data objects for echellograms, 1-dimensional spectra, and radial velocities which are all instrument independent.

Data Containers¶

class pychell.data.rvdata.CompositeRVData¶

Bases: dict

classmethod from_radvel_file(fname, wavelengths=None)¶

Constructs a new RV data object from a standard radvel csv file.

Parameters

fname (str) – The full path to the file.

Returns

The CompositeRVData set.

Return type

CompositeRVData

gen_indices()¶

Utility function to generate the indices of each dataset (when sorted according to x).

Returns

A dictionary with keys = data labels, values = numpy array of indices (ints).

Return type

dict

gen_tel_vec()¶

Generates a vector where each index corresponds to the label of measurement x, sorted by x as well.

Returns

The label vector sorted according to self.indices.

Return type

np.ndarray

get_vec(attr, sort=True, labels=None)¶

Gets a vector for certain labels and possibly sorts it.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – The attribute to get.

  • sort (bool) – Whether or not to sort the returned vector according to x.

  • labels (list of strings, optional) – The labels to get. Defaults to all.

Returns

The vector, sorted according to x if sort=True.

Return type

np.ndarray

get_view(instnames)¶

Returns a view into sub data objects. :param labels: The labels to get. :type labels: str or list of strings

Returns

A view into the original data object.

Return type

type(self)

property time_baseline¶

T_max - T_min

Returns

The time baseline.

Return type

float

to_radvel_file(fname)¶

Creates a radvel input file from an instance.

Parameters

fname (str) – The full path and filename of the file to create. If the file exists, it is overwritten.

pychell currently supports the following spectrographs. Only iSHELL, PARVI, and NIRSPEC come with support for spectral extraction. For spectrographs with multiple modes, typically only the ideal mode for precise RVs is supported. pychell is able to support RVs for all spectrographs from 1-dimensional spectra.
